intro: Hibbertia selkii, commonly known as the Selkii bush or golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is found in regions such as Western Australia and South Australia. Hibbertia selkii is a shrub that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height, with a woody stem and showy inflorescences. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native habitat.
